channel.title: Blu-Ray Vs. HD-DVD
channel.description:
Which is better blu-ray or hd-dvd?
Discuss (I like blu-ray, also blu-ray is in ps3s)
Here are some specs and info:
INFO:
Blu-Ray and HD-DVD are two new optical storage technologies that fight as the successor of DVD. They are both high def!!!
SPECS:
Blu-Ray: ROM single layer:23.3 / 25GB ROM dual layer:46.6 / 50GB RW single layer:23.3 / 25 / 27GB RW dual layer:46.6 / 50 / 54GB Highest test:100GB Theoretical limit:200GB
HD DVD: Single layer:15GB Dual layer:30GB Highest test:45GB Theoretical limit:60GB
Pros about Blu-Ray: * Blu-ray can hold a lot more data than standard DVDs. * They can hold high-definition video (up to 1920x1080 pixels) * Up to 100gb of storage
Cons about Blu-Ray: * Some glitches still need to be worked out... * Formats are weird. * Expensive
HD-DVD Pros: * Cheaper than Blu-Ray * Can hold up to 45-50gb of data
HD-DVD Cons: * Can't hold as much as Blu-Ray can * Almost no movies are out for HD-DVD

item.title: Blu-Ray Vs. HD-DVD
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

HD-DVD Cons:

  • Can’t hold as much as Blu-Ray can
  • Almost no movies are out for HD-DVD

Dude, take the last bit out. HD-DVD, and even blueray is still brand spanking new, you can’t expect shit to just appear out of no where when it’s relatively new.

BTW, I bote HD-DVD, from what I can tell(I live in Plymouth, the worlds end so shit gets to me slower) bluerays are ridiculously expensive when HD-DVD is perfect. Shit doesn’t need to be perfect on a microscopic level, it needs to be perfect for it’s cost witch is where blueray doesn’t look appealing.

(Although theroy of 200gb does look sexy, not for me, dun wanna buy new laptop to use blueray cd’s as new hdd .)

Read full topic

item.title: Blu-Ray Vs. HD-DVD
item.dc:creator: @Monkey_wacko Monkey wacko
item.description:
@Monkey_wacko wrote:

Which is better blu-ray or hd-dvd?

Discuss (I like blu-ray, also blu-ray is in ps3s)

Here are some specs and info:

INFO:

Blu-Ray and HD-DVD are two new optical storage technologies that fight as the successor of DVD. They are both high def!!!

SPECS:

Blu-Ray:
ROM single layer:23.3 / 25GB
ROM dual layer:46.6 / 50GB
RW single layer:23.3 / 25 / 27GB
RW dual layer:46.6 / 50 / 54GB
Highest test:100GB
Theoretical limit:200GB

HD DVD:
Single layer:15GB
Dual layer:30GB
Highest test:45GB
Theoretical limit:60GB

Pros about Blu-Ray:

  • Blu-ray can hold a lot more data than standard DVDs.
  • They can hold high-definition video (up to 1920x1080 pixels)
  • Up to 100gb of storage

Cons about Blu-Ray:

  • Some glitches still need to be worked out…
  • Formats are weird.
  • Expensive

HD-DVD Pros:

  • Cheaper than Blu-Ray
  • Can hold up to 45-50gb of data

HD-DVD Cons:

  • Can’t hold as much as Blu-Ray can
  • Almost no movies are out for HD-DVD
